t.c: c Nuwan Kulasekara b Lasith Malinga

d.c: OUT! Amla holes out! Short and wide outside off, Amla goes back and cuts it hard but towards the wide backward point region. Kulasekara runs hard to his right from third man and takes a brilliant diving catch. There was no need for this shot.

t.c: c Quinton de Kock b Kyle Abbott
c Faf du Plessis b Dale Steyn
c David Miller b Morne Morkel
c Faf du Plessis b Imran Tahir
c Faf du Plessis b JP Duminy
c Rilee Rossouw b Imran Tahir
c Quinton de Kock b JP Duminy
c David Miller b Imran Tahir

d.c: OUT! This time he edges it! After living a cat's life at the crease, Perera departs! Full and just outside off, nips away just a shade, Perera comes forward to push at it and gets an outside edge towards first slip. de Kock flies in the air, literally, to his left and tries to pouch that one but the ball bounces off his hands. He still manages to grab it after fumbling. What a magnificent catch. Arnold had reckoned that Lankans would be at ease but the start has taken a different path here.

OUT! One more bites the dust! Another terrific catch! Dilshan goes for a 7-ball duck! Lands on a length around off, jags away a tad. Dilshan camps back and looks to punch that one but gets a thick outside edge through to second slip. du Plessis dives low to his right and takes a terrific catch. The saffas showing their intentions. Steyn is pumped and lord he looks scary as he roars in with aggression. They are pumped out there. The Lankans struggling at 4 for 2 now. Dream start for the Proteas.

OUT! Very soft dismissal! Floated on middle and leg, spins in a tad, Thirimanne comes forward to push it down the ground but eventually plays it back to Tahir, due to some extra bounce, who leaps in air to his left and pouches it safely. He was bowling over the wicket before this but changed side and bowled round the wicket. Seems like a plan has fallen in place.

OUT! Jayawardene's poor run continues! Flat and short just outside off, Mahela camps back to pull that one but gets no timing whatsoever behind this one as it was a googly. The ball goes straight to du Plessis who takes a sitter and Tahir takes off again. Sri Lanka under deep, deep pressure.

OUT! Mathews perishes! Floated wide outside off, Mathews comes down the track and tries to play it over the mid-wicket fielder but only manages to drag it to du Plessis at mid-wicket who makes no mistake. Sri Lanka just not able to get a move on! 50 ODI wickets for Duminy!

OUT! Second wicket of the over! Flat on off, goes straight on, Perera tries to punch it off the back foot but gets an outside edge. The ball hits de Kock's glove and balloons towards Rossouw who takes the easiest of catch. Tahir is doing the damage here. Rather, spin is doing the damage.

OUT! Some sportsman spirit! He walked off there. Flighted outside off, drifts away. Kulasekara looks to defend that one but the ball goes straight on and induces a thin outside edge. de Kock gathers it and there is a huge appeal. The umpire does not agree to it but hang on! Kulasekara is walking off. That was a bold decision to make as his side is in deep trouble.

OUT! Two in tow! As plumb as it gets! That is a hat-trick as he took a wicket off the last delivery of his previous over! Fires this flat on middle and off, skids straight on, Kaushal camps back to defend that one but is rapped on the pads. Huge appeal and the dreaded fingers goes up in a jiffy. JP is ecstatic and rightly so. He was selected to do the 5th bowler's work and boy he has delivered. First South African to take a hat-trick in World Cups.

OUT! Sangakkara holes out! Short and outside off, Sangakkara cuts it hard but straight to third man where Miller takes a straight forward to catch. Sri Lanka's last hope fades away. This probably will be the last time we see the southpaw dawn the dark blue jersey for the Lankans. Take a bow Kumar.

OUT! Straight to the man! Flat and short outside off, Malinga makes room and plays it with a flat bat, he fails to keep it down and the ball finds the waiting hands of David Miller at cover who makes no mistake. Sri Lanka's misery ends and they are shot out for a paltry 133.
